job_details.degree_required: BS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field/technical experience

jd:
From: bhaskar, SPEAR STAFFING bhaskar@spearstaffing.com Reply to: bhaskar@spearstaffing.com Position: MS SQL Server DBA
Location: Remote
Duration: 6+ months c2h
Interview process: 2 rounds

The Database Administrator (MS SQL Server DBA) will provide services for all support issues submitted by Company Employees. Duties will include proactively monitoring performance and capacity, performance tuning, query optimization, evaluating and integrating new products, resolving computing issues, and supporting database replication. Also, you will support on-premise and cloud-based databases.

Core Responsibilities:
• As the Database Administrator (DBA), you will be responsible for:
• Optimizing and tuning database systems
• Ensuring adherence to storage, archiving, and back-up recovery procedures
• Backup recovery testing of recovery procedures and archiving databases
• Disaster recovery testing
• Troubleshooting database issues and performing database impact analysis for proposed changes
• Controlling access permissions and privileges
• Altering tables and schema structure as required
• Working with the application development teams to develop stored procedures, triggers, and code to support enterprise applications, as well as to enforce coding standards
• Executing database release management processes and coordinating maintenance of development, testing, and production environments
• Physical database design
• Other duties as assigned

What are we looking for?
We’re looking for motivated professionals with:
• BS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field/technical experience
• Expert administration/engineering skills in Windows OS technologies
• Expert MS SQL Server DBA
• Minimum of 5 years supporting Windows operating systems and technologies, including Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, and group policies
• Advanced knowledge in automating for Windows platforms leveraging PowerShell, ActiveBatch, and SCCM or MDT
• Minimum of 7 years of experience in administering multi-terabyte MS SQL Server databases
• Proficiency with SQL, T-SQL, PowerShell
• Must be expert at performance optimization and root cause analysis
• Experience in administering a multi-terabyte data warehouse is preferred
• Strong technical ability and outstanding troubleshooting skills
• Ability to research emerging technologies and make recommendations that benefit our business
• MongoDB skills are a big plus
• Strong customer service orientation

Thanks, and regards
Bhaskar Negi
Senior Technical Recruiter
Phone- +1 2402058513
